page.title: 13Helping the Unemployed.
page.content: Quedgeley's redundant Junior School now houses the St. James Project which is funded by the Manpower Services Commision and sponsored by the Gloucester Diocesan churches. Its aim is to help long term unemployed people from 18 to 60 years get back into the habit of regular work. The 40 people on the site undertake work for the elderly and disabled. The canteen provides up to 100 low cost meals ( 80p_Â£1) per day for them. In addition, the building is used as a Community Centre for everyone and is used by the Youth Club, Weight Watchers, Keep Fit Classes and Dancing School. There are facilities too for a creche and a playschool.
